meanings.definition: The fact of surpassing all others; superiority.
meanings.sent1: Her preeminences in academics made her stand out among her classmates.
meanings.sent2: The preeminences of the team were evident in their flawless performance.
meanings.sent3: Despite his preeminences in chess, he still lost to his younger brother.
meanings.sent4: The preeminences of the mountain peak were visible from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The preeminences of the sun in the sky were undeniable.

meanings.definition: The quality of being distinguished or outstanding.
meanings.sent1: The preeminences of her artwork were recognized by art critics worldwide.
meanings.sent2: His preeminences in leadership were acknowledged by everyone in the company.
meanings.sent3: The cat's preeminences in laziness were both amusing and frustrating.
meanings.sent4: The preeminences of the star athlete shone brightly during the championship.
meanings.sent5: The preeminences of the flower's fragrance filled the entire room.

meanings.definition: A position of superiority or dominance.
meanings.sent1: She secured the preeminences in the company through hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent2: The preeminences of the king were unquestioned by his subjects.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel claimed preeminences over the bird feeder in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The preeminences of the eagle in the sky symbolized freedom and power.
meanings.sent5: The preeminences of the ocean waves crashing against the shore were mesmerizing.
